nuvolari - (09:51): I have a question regarding the context setting of xwiki. I can't remember if I asked this before but for some reason when the xwiki path is hit, it prepends the URL where it should go with "duplicate" domain info. Eg: http://xwiki.host.com/ redirects to http://xwiki.host.com/xwikihttp://xwiki.host.com/xwiki/bin/login/XWiki/XWikiLogin?srid=S4YlfTD8  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:02  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:18): nuvolari: I would double check the xwiki.cfg file, there is a setting for redirecting the url for virtual wikis.

vmassol - (11:10): hmmm I got a permgen error on trunk after leaving XE for 2 days: http://tinypaste.com/97808  
vmassol - (11:10): I tried to navigate to a page using ctrl+G  
vmassol - (11:11): then I entered some text and a js alert appeared with a permgen error message  
glerouge joined #xwiki at 11:18  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:19): Interesting, I've been running XE for 4 days and no permgen errors. I'm using postgres, maybe hsqldb pushes it over the top?  
vmassol - (11:23): CalebJamesDeLisl: it might be  
vmassol - (11:23): I'm doing some changes in the IRC bot app  
vmassol - (11:23): and it's possible it has some memory leak  
vmassol - (11:23): that's more likely IMO  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (11:24): That makes sense, testing groovy eval would create a lot of classes.  
vmassol - (11:24): but that means the irc app could create some instabilities where it's installed  
vmassol - (11:24): would need to get to the bottom of it at some point  
sdumitriu - (11:27): vmassol: If it's caused just by reloading, then it's not a big problem  
sdumitriu - (11:27): Users don't change it too often, right?  
vmassol - (11:27): no they don't but we do from time to time  
vmassol - (11:28): and we could bring xwiki.org down because of this  
vmassol - (11:28): also I'm worried that this could be caused by  
vmassol - (11:28): {{groovy jars="…"  
tmortagne - (11:29): vmassol: because we create a new classloader for each rendering that would not be properly removed by GC ? that would explain the permgen  
vmassol - (11:30): yes something like that

bblfish - (14:11): if I put a velocity page into my repository, what extension should I give it?  
vmassol - (14:12): ah I need to put back the irc bot excludes  
vmassol - (14:12): doing it now  
vmassol - (14:12): bblfish: you need to export the page as a XAR  
vmassol - (14:12): (ie an XML file)  
bblfish - (14:12): ok  
vmassol - (14:12): you have some ex of apps here: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/  
vmassol - (14:13): we have a maven plugin to genertae a XAR file out of a list of files  
bblfish - (14:13): ah yes, I see the menu item now, thanks  
vmassol - (14:13): this plugin is used in the link I gave you  
vmassol - (14:13): http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/  
vmassol - (14:13): for ex for the blog app: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/  
vmassol - (14:14): specifying <package>xar</package> uses it automatically  
vmassol - (14:14): (but you need the build extensions defined in http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-applications/trunk/pom.xml)  
bblfish - (14:15): ok, let me try  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 14:16  
vmassol - (14:23): !news  
xwikibot joined #xwiki at 14:27  
vmassol - (14:27): !news  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 14:28  
jvelociter - (14:28): Hi guys  
vmassol - (14:28): !news  
vmassol - (14:28): hmm doesn't seem to work :(  
vmassol - (14:28): !news  
vmassol - (14:28): grrr  
jvelociter - (14:29): Do we have a cross-wiki URL issue on XEM 2.2  ?  
vmassol - (14:29): jvdrean: it's possible but I don't know about it  
vmassol - (14:29): have you found a pb?  
jvelociter - (14:29): the URL to my profile on incubator is http://localhost/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/JeromeVelociter instead of http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/JeromeVelociter  
vmassol - (14:30): right  
vmassol - (14:30): seems like a bug, can you create a jira for it?  
vmassol - (14:30): that's a quite important regression  
jvelociter - (14:31): though [[Test inter wiki>>jerome:Main.WebHome]] this resolve correctly  
vmassol - (14:31): it's strange because I remember I checked this....  
sdumitriu - (14:33): jvelociter: Where is that link?  
vmassol - (14:33): hmm just tested on my local XEM and it's working  
jvelociter - (14:34): sdumitriu: which one ?  
jvelociter - (14:34): vmassol: let me try something  
jvelociter - (14:34): http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Sandbox/Test  
jvelociter - (14:34): ( sdumitriu 0  
jvelociter - (14:34): )  
jvelociter - (14:36): restarting myxwiki.org  
jvelociter - (14:39): ok did not worked. I have seen a similar issue on socracy that a restart fixed, but here it's not the case  
jvelociter - (14:39): I still have the pb  
vmassol - (14:40): the pb is that I can't reproduce it locally  
jvelociter - (14:40): strange  
vmassol - (14:41): I'm on trunk though but I doubt anything has changed regarding this  
jvelociter - (14:41): you have a XEM 2.2, with a global user on a local wiki ?  
vmassol - (14:41): ah no  
vmassol - (14:41): you're logging with your global user on the local wiki?  
jvelociter - (14:41): yes  
vmassol - (14:41): ok let me retry  
vmassol - (14:43): I have a different pb but maybe my install is not right, I'll rebuild  
vmassol - (14:43): right now I can log in fine, the url is ok but I don't have any right to see any page  
vmassol - (14:44): I think it'll work if you log with xwiki: as prefix  
jvelociter - (14:44): I can login  
jvelociter - (14:44): just the URL to my profile in the top right corner is wrong  
tmortagne - (14:44): vmassol: this is not supposed to change anything  
vmassol - (14:45): I know  
vmassol - (14:45): but I changed stuff regarding this when I moved to references  
vmassol - (14:45): AFAIR  
vmassol - (14:45): so it's possible I introduced a regression  
tmortagne - (14:45): i'm looking  
vmassol - (14:45): ok thanks  
tmortagne - (14:54): hmm, i maybe know what is the issue actually (not a bug but wrong configuration), checking  
tmortagne - (14:54): myxwiki.org seems down  
vmassol - (14:55): tmortagne: I'm getting weird stuff on my local xem too  
tmortagne - (14:55): www.myxwiki.org is working  
tmortagne - (14:55): there is something wrong with the DNS since myxwiki.org used to work recently  
tmortagne - (14:56): main wiki descriptor is not properlu configured on myxwiki.org  
tmortagne - (14:56): i think that's my fault (ovveride during upgrade)  
tmortagne - (14:56): fixing it  
tmortagne - (14:57): jvelociter: should be ok now  
tmortagne - (14:57): vmassol: like what ?  
vmassol - (14:59): when I log with the global user I don't have permissions to see any doc  
vmassol - (14:59): but I'm rebuilding  
vmassol - (14:59): it might be a pb with my local build which is kind of old now  
tmortagne - (14:59): vmassol: it's working well for me on trunk  
vmassol - (14:59): ok cool  
tmortagne - (14:59): vmassol: mayeb you removed your global user from allgroup  
jvelociter left at 15:00 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds

vmassol - (15:01): oh right  
vmassol - (15:01): that's why then :)

tmortagne - (15:11): path

jvelociter - (15:14): neither did I had the previous 2 one you copied  
tmortagne - (15:14): indeed

jvelociter - (15:14): ah  
jvelociter - (15:14): right  
jvelociter - (15:14): flaky connection here  
tmortagne - (15:14): but that was after, you whouls have it in your history  
jvelociter - (15:14): numericable  
jvelociter - (15:14): :)  
jvelociter - (15:14): history is only on jabber no ?  
tmortagne - (15:15): history is on you client  
tmortagne - (15:15): jabber or irc doe snot matter  
tmortagne - (15:15): wat i mean is that you were connected  
tmortagne - (15:15): when i sent theses messages  
vmassol - (15:16): server history is only on jabber indeed  
jvelociter - (15:22): no maybe not  
jvelociter - (15:22): since I got disconnected by timeout  
jvelociter - (15:22): I was probably already out  
jvelociter - (15:22): anyway, it does not matter much  
vmassol - (15:37): tmortagne: it doesn't work for me locally with a complete new trunk build  
tmortagne - (15:37): vmassol:  how do you test that and what do you get exactly ?  
vmassol - (15:38): \* Create user on main wiki, add it to the admin group  
vmassol - (15:38): \* Log in on subwiki with that user  
vmassol - (15:38): \* check profile url at top right of screen  
tmortagne - (15:38): domain based multiwiki ?  
vmassol - (15:38): yes  
tmortagne - (15:39): can you try to log on main wiki and then go to subwiki just to see if that make a difference  
tmortagne - (15:39): (switching to domain based multiwiki to test several things)  
vmassol - (15:39): log with the same user?  
tmortagne - (15:40): yes just log first on main wiki  
vmassol - (15:40): tmortagne: same  
tmortagne - (15:41): ok, i'm restarting to re-try but it's working well on myxwiki.org and it was working when i did a quick test  
vmassol - (15:42): I used the wiki manager to create the subwiki  
tmortagne - (15:42): what use login are you using ? full name or just the simple user name ?  
vmassol - (15:42): do I need to check something?  
vmassol - (15:42): I've created a user with id = "test"  
tmortagne - (15:42): vmassol: not really no, there only one kind of subwiki  
vmassol - (15:42): I log with "test"  
vmassol - (15:43): i have an alias of incubator.localdomain.com  
vmassol - (15:43): and in my etc/hosts this name points to localhost  
tmortagne - (15:43): i definitely work well for me  
tmortagne - (15:43): it  
tmortagne - (15:43): what is the alias of your main wiki ?  
vmassol - (15:43): 127.0.0.1       incubator.localdomain.com  
tmortagne - (15:43): in teh wiki descriptor  
tmortagne - (15:43): the main alias  
vmassol - (15:43): http://incubator.localdomain.com/  
tmortagne - (15:44): no the alias, the domain name in the main wiki descriptor property  
tmortagne - (15:44): http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiServerXwiki  
vmassol - (15:44): Alias:  
vmassol - (15:44): incubator.localdomain.com  
vmassol - (15:44): The alias used to access the wiki.  
tmortagne - (15:45): that's for the main wiki or the sub wiki ?  
vmassol - (15:45): it's on http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiServerIncubator  
tmortagne - (15:45): ok but what do you have in http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiServerXwiki ?  
vmassol - (15:45): ah let me cheeck the main one I didn't know thre was one  
tmortagne - (15:45): for the main wiki  
vmassol - (15:46): there's no such descirptor  
tmortagne - (15:46): it's what is used to generate the URL targeting the main wiki  
tmortagne - (15:46): you installed XEM xar ?  
vmassol - (15:46): no  
vmassol - (15:46): so this descriptor is mandatory?  
tmortagne - (15:47): it's not supposed to be mandatory if you don't need to access the main wiki with a specific domain  
tmortagne - (15:47): let me look at something  
vmassol - (15:47): but indeed I missed this part in your doc:  
vmassol - (15:47): "[optional] If your main wiki domain name does not start with "www" (or will not be accessed by IP or "localhost")"  
tmortagne - (15:48): i'm not sure what is used to generate the URL targeting the main wiki where there is not descriptor  
vmassol - (15:48): so according to the doc it must be created  
tmortagne - (15:48): no  
tmortagne - (15:48): according to the doc it's optional  
vmassol - (15:48): hmm right  
tmortagne - (15:48): since you access your main wiki an IP  
vmassol - (15:48): that's why I didn't create it actually  
vmassol - (15:48): I don't  
vmassol - (15:49): I access it using localhost  
tmortagne - (15:49): yes it's part of the if too  
vmassol - (15:49): ok  
tmortagne - (15:49): checking RULFactory, it's possible there is an issue when there is no main wiki descriptor since it doe snot know what to use  
tmortagne - (15:50): i'm not even sure what to use  
tmortagne - (15:50): maybe trying to resolve current domain ip  
tmortagne - (15:50): (i'm sure it doe snot do that :) )  
tmortagne - (15:51): i guess URL factory use the current domain when it can't find explicit domain for a tageted wiki  
tmortagne - (15:51): vmassol: can you try in url patch based mode ?  
vmassol - (15:51): I'm adding a main descirptor  
vmassol - (15:52): what should I use for the server?  
vmassol - (15:52): (it's missing from the doc)  
tmortagne - (15:52): "server"="alias"  
vmassol - (15:52): yes what should I use ?  
tmortagne - (15:53): server is converted into alias in the UI  
vmassol - (15:53): localhost?  
tmortagne - (15:53): what you want, use the domain you want to use to access the main wiki  
vmassol - (15:53): I don't use a domain  
vmassol - (15:53): to access the main wiki  
tmortagne - (15:53): 127.0.0.1, localhost, etc...  
tmortagne - (15:53): localhost is a domain  
vmassol - (15:53): ok  
tmortagne - (15:53): irt's just a reserved one  
vmassol - (15:54): so indeed with a main wiki descriptor it works  
vmassol - (15:54): so the pb is when there's no main descriptor  
tmortagne - (15:55): yes, the probleme is generally to find the proper domain when there is no wiki descriptor  
tmortagne - (15:55): for main wiki or another wiki  
vmassol - (15:55): should we modify the doc to make it mandatory?  
vmassol - (15:55): or can we fix it?  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 15:56  
tmortagne - (15:56): hmm impossible to fix it for sub wiki for sure, now for main wiki i'm not sure  
tmortagne - (15:56): 127.0.0.1 or locahost are not right  
bblfish - (15:56): hello the foafssl code is in git here: http://github.com/bblfish/keygenapp/tree/xwiki2  
tmortagne - (15:56): but maybe resolve the current domain would be ok  
jvelociter left at 15:57 (Ping timeout: 248 seconds  
tmortagne - (15:57): i will try that  
vmassol - (15:57): when you import the XEM XAR  
vmassol - (15:57): what's the default server value for the main desc?  
tmortagne - (15:57): locahost  
tmortagne - (15:58): but we cna't use localhost since in a normal use case it never works  
tmortagne - (15:59): as default i mean  
vmassol - (16:00): so the XAR XEM never works in a normal use case?  
tmortagne - (16:00): another way is to cache for each wiki the last URL that accessed to it  
tmortagne - (16:00): and use it as default  
vmassol - (16:00): (meaning the user must edit it)  
tmortagne - (16:01): vmassol: yes user must edit it but anyway most of the time he wants to edit it because he wan't to put a nice domain name, something we can't guess  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 16:03  
tmortagne - (16:11): vmassol: you can avoid setting main wiki descriptor by setting xwiki.home property in xwiki.cfg  
tmortagne - (16:12): URLFactory tries to used it for main wiki  
bblfish - (16:18): the foafssl code currently only creates keys. It is not set up to be verifiable yet

vmassol - (17:52): thanks jerome :)

bblfish - (17:58): is there a way to get the full URL of a page?  
bblfish - (17:59): from velocity  
sdumitriu - (17:59): getExternalURL  
vmassol - (18:00): sdumitriu: I know of the bot not excluding the watchlist notif anymore. I'll fix it  
bblfish - (18:02): sdumitriu: thanks. what object is that called on?  
vmassol - (18:02): the document  
bblfish - (18:02): thanks  
vmassol - (18:02): for ex $doc.getExternalURL(….)  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 18:03  
arkub left at 18:11 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
npm joined #xwiki at 18:12  
bblfish - (18:17): vmassol: $doc.getExternalURL(….) is transformed or is a hyperlink - anyway to stop that from happening?  
vmassol - (18:18): checking code  
vmassol - (18:18): bblfish: you mean it generates somr HTML?  
bblfish - (18:18): yes  
vmassol - (18:18): that would be strange  
bblfish - (18:19): I tried to put in in a <a href="$...  
vmassol - (18:19): however if you put a URL in wiki syntax it is transformed into a link  
bblfish - (18:19):  <td><input name="webid" id="webid" type="hidden" value="$doc.getExternalURL()\#me">$doc.getExternalURL()\#me</input></td>  
vmassol - (18:20): bblfish: it's not getExternalURL  
vmassol - (18:20): this method always returns a URL as a string  
vmassol - (18:20): but again if you put a URL as wiki syntax  
vmassol - (18:20): then it's transformed into a link  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (18:20): Try {{html wiki=false}} $escapetool.html($doc.getExternalURL()) {{/html}} and you'll see exactly what it's outputting.  
vmassol - (18:21): if you don't want it to be transformed as a link  
bblfish - (18:22): ah yes, I have wiki=true at the beginning of the page  
vmassol - (18:22): you can either tell the html macro not to parse the content as wiki syntax
